Description: Federated Department Stores, Inc. agreed to pay an $850,000 civil penalty to settle CPSC charges that it knowingly sold flammable garments as children's sleepwear.
Info Source: https://www.cpsc.gov/Newsroom/News-Releases/2001/httpwwwcpscgovCPSCPUBPRERELprhtml0101123html

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The Justice Department reached an agreement with Macy's over allegations that the large national retailer violated the Immigration and Nationality Act by discriminating against work-authorized non-U.S. citizens at its Glendale, California, location.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/justice-department-settles-immigration-related-discrimination-claim-against-macy-s

Description: sale of children's sweatshirts and jackets
Info Source: http://www.cpsc.gov/en/Newsroom/News-Releases/2011/Macys-Agrees-to-Pay-750000-Civil-Penalty-for-Failing-to-Report-Drawstrings-in-Childrens-Outerwear1/

Description: Amazon.com, Inc.; Leon Max, Inc.; Macy's, Inc.; and Sears, Roebuck and Co. and its Kmart subsidiaries, Kmart Corporation and Kmart.com, agreed to pay penalties totaling $1.26 million to settle Federal Trade Commission charges that they violated the Textile Products Identification Act (Textile Act) and the FTC's Textile Rules by labeling and advertising products sold in stores and online as made of bamboo, while they actually were made of rayon.
Info Source: https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2013/01/four-national-retailers-agree-pay-penalties-totaling-126-million

Description: Seven large Internet e-tailers agreed to settle Federal Trade Commission allegations that they violated the Mail and Telephone Order Rule during the 1999 holiday shopping season by providing buyers inadequate notice of shipping delays or continuing to promise specific delivery dates when timely fulfillment was impossible.
Info Source: https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2000/07/seven-internet-retailers-settle-ftc-charges-over-shipping-delays

Description: A group of major retailers and a group of jewelry manufacturers joined a settlement involving the presence of lead in costume jewelry sold to children.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-lockyer-announces-settlement-major-us-companies-reduce-lead

Description: The New York Attorney General announced settlements with two leading department store chains and two prominent manufacturers of tableware to resolve allegations that the companies conspired to limit distribution of products sold to consumers.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20101119015336/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2004/aug/aug10a_04.html
https://web.archive.org/web/20101111173439/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2006/mar/mar14a_06.html

Description: The New York State Attorney General signed an agreement with Macy?s East, Inc. to ensure that race and ethnicity play no role in security efforts to identify and process suspected shoplifters.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20101113170356/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2005/jan/jan14a_05.html

Description: The New York Attorney General announced an agreement with Macy's Retail Holdings, Inc., addressing more than a dozen recent complaints of profiling and false detentions at Macy's flagship store in Manhattan's Herald Square.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20190803151639/https://ag.ny.gov/press-release/ag-schneiderman-announces-agreement-macys-prevent-discrimination-against-customers

Description: The New York Attorney General announced settlements with two leading department store chains and two prominent manufacturers of tableware to resolve allegations that the companies conspired to limit distribution of products sold to consumers.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20101119015336/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2004/aug/aug10a_04.html

Description: Macy's agreed to pay $1.2 million in settlement of allegations by five California District Attorneys that it failed to charge customers accurate prices at checkout scanners.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20100527132343/http://da.lacounty.gov/mr/archive/2004/052104a.htm

Description: Macy's Corporate Services pleaded no contest to a misdemeanor count over the decapitation of an employee who fell into an unguarded and unsupervised cardboard bailing and crushing machine. The plea included a negotiated settlement with a $950,000 fine.
Info Source: http://da.lacounty.gov/media/news/macys-pleads-death-employee

Private Litigation Case Title: Garcia et al v. Macy's West Stores, Inc. et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/1215328/macy-s-drivers-get-3-5m-wage-deal-with-xpo-unit-approved
